div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1086 Olbia (mod. Parutino), Ochakov raion, Nikolaev oblast, Ukraine, 1946 Burial: c. 300-250 B.C. Contents: 10 AE. On floor of one room in agora; 8 together and 2 separately Olbia: 2 fish-shaped AE 4 aes grave (as AMNG I.1, pl. 8, 2 [3]; Burachkov, pl. 1, 6 [1]) 3 AE (as AMNG I.1, pl. 9, 23 [2], 26-29 [1]) Istrus: 1 AE (as AMNG I.1, pl. 8, 7) Disposition: Kiev Kharko, "Ol'viia," pp. 350-1, nos. 155-64
